title: Video: Why we know so little about human reproduction
subtitle: Inside our correspondents’ investigation into the future of fertility

contents.text: Catherine Brahic, The Economist’s environment editor, and Sacha Nauta, our social affairs editor, have spent months delving into the assisted-reproduction industry. They examine its flaws and how women’s experiences differ globally. Here they share some highlights from their reporting and insights about what the future may hold.
